revised_title: The Strain Theory of Photographic Action and Its Implications
tldr: The author investigates the strain theory of photographic action, exploring the effects of light, electric radiation, and mechanical disturbance on sensitive substances. The study reveals the importance of molecular strain in modifying chemical activity and the potential for physical strain to produce photographic effects. The research also highlights the role of sensitization in preventing self-recovery and making after-effects more permanent.
